meanings.definition: Giving out or reflecting a strong or dazzling light.
meanings.sent1: The sun's glaring rays made me squint.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight's glaring beam illuminated the dark path.
meanings.sent3: The glaring light from the disco ball made everyone look like dancing stars.
meanings.sent4: The glaring headlights of the oncoming car blinded me momentarily.
meanings.sent5: The glaring neon sign attracted customers from afar.

meanings.sent1: She glared angrily at her brother for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The teacher glared sternly at the noisy students.
meanings.sent3: The cat glaringly watched the mouse scurry across the room.
meanings.sent4: The security guard glared suspiciously at the person entering the building.
meanings.sent5: The boss glared disapprovingly at the late employee.

meanings.sent1: His glaring mistake in the report was hard to miss.
meanings.sent2: The glaring error in the painting stood out immediately.
meanings.sent3: The glaringly obvious solution was right in front of them all along.
meanings.sent4: The glaring lack of communication led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The glaring contrast between the two colors made the room vibrant.
